thread.title: Maple Leafs’ Frederik Andersen pulled against Stars
thread.title_full: Maple Leafs’ Frederik Andersen pulled against Stars

author: Ryan McKenna
title: Maple Leafs’ Frederik Andersen pulled against Stars
text:
Presented by: Maple Leafs’ Frederik Andersen pulled against Stars 
The Toronto Maple Leafs might need a dew more days off after allowing two goals in less than five minutes of their game against the Dallas Stars. Ryan McKenna January 31, 2017, 9:11 PM Ryan McKenna January 31, 2017, 9:11 PM 
It wasn’t the return from the All-Star break that Frederik Andersen was looking for. 
The Toronto Maple Leafs goaltender was pulled after allowing three goals on eight shots Tuesday night against the Dallas Stars . 
Devin Shore, Radek Faksa and Lauri Korpikoski all scored within the first 11:18 to chase Andersen from the Toronto net. 
Curtis McElhinney came on in relief for the Maple Leafs, who entered the game one point out of a wild-card spot in the Eastern Conference. More from Sportsnet
